Production Bug Fixes - Patch Branch

Branch: patch/fix-feedback-and-api-keys-bugs
Date: 2025-11-13
Status: ‚úÖ Fixed and Ready for Testing

Overview

This patch addresses two critical production bugs discovered after deployment:

  1. Feedback Submission Error - Unable to submit feedback due to schema mismatch
  2. API Keys Save Error - Authentication issues when saving API keys

Bug #1: Feedback Submission Error

Problem

Users were unable to submit feedback, receiving the error:

Could not find the 'priority' column of 'feedback' in the schema cache

Root Cause

The FeedbackModal.tsx component was attempting to insert a priority field that exists in the database schema but wasn‚Äôt being recognized due to a schema cache issue. Additionally, there was a type mismatch where the code used "feature" but the database constraint only allows "bug" or "idea".

Solution

File: FeedbackModal.tsx

  1. Removed explicit priority field (line 102):
    • The priority column has a DEFAULT value in the database ('medium')
    • No need to specify it explicitly in the insert operation
    • This avoids the schema cache issue
  2. Fixed type mismatch (lines 31, 168, 177-178):
    • Changed type from "bug" | "feature" to "bug" | "idea"
    • Updated radio button value from "feature" to "idea"
    • Updated radio button ID from "type-feature" to "type-idea"
    • This matches the database CHECK constraint: type IN ('bug', 'idea')

Changes Made

// Before
const [type, setType] = useState<"bug" | "feature">("bug");
priority: type === "bug" ? "medium" : "low",

// After
const [type, setType] = useState<"bug" | "idea">("bug");
// priority has a DEFAULT value in the database, so we don't need to specify it

Database Schema Reference

From 20251112000001_create_feedback_table.sql:

priority TEXT DEFAULT 'medium' CHECK (priority IN ('low', 'medium', 'high', 'critical')),
type TEXT NOT NULL CHECK (type IN ('bug', 'idea')),

Bug #2: API Keys Save Error

Problem

Users were unable to save API keys, receiving authentication errors even when logged in. The error message asked users to ‚Äúlogin/logout and try again.‚Äù

Root Cause

The authentication flow in ApiKeysSettingsModal.tsx wasn‚Äôt properly validating the session before attempting to save. This could lead to: - Stale session tokens - Missing session validation - Unclear error messages for users

Solution

File: ApiKeysSettingsModal.tsx

Enhanced the handleSave() function with:

  1. Session Validation First (lines 145-156):
    • Check session validity before attempting user operations
    • Provide clear error messages if session is invalid
    • Added comprehensive logging for debugging
  2. Better Error Handling (lines 172-186):
    • Specific error messages based on error codes
    • Code 42501: Permission denied (migration not applied)
    • Code 23505: Duplicate entry
    • Detailed console logging for troubleshooting
  3. Explicit NULL Handling (lines 163-169):
    • Convert empty strings to null for database consistency
    • Prevents issues with empty string vs null comparisons
  4. Enhanced Debugging (throughout):
    • Added emoji-prefixed console logs for easy filtering
    • Log session validation, user authentication, and upsert operations
    • Include error codes, messages, and hints in error logs

Changes Made

// Added session validation
const { data: { session }, error: sessionError } = await supabase.auth.getSession();

if (sessionError) {
    throw new Error("Session error. Please refresh the page and try again.");
}

if (!session) {
    throw new Error("No active session. Please log out and log back in.");
}

// Better error handling with specific messages
if (upsertError.code === "42501") {
    throw new Error("Permission denied. The database migration may not have been applied yet.");
} else if (upsertError.code === "23505") {
    throw new Error("Duplicate entry detected. Please try again.");
}

RLS Policies Reference

From 20251112180000_create_user_api_keys_table.sql:

CREATE POLICY "Users can insert own API keys"
    ON user_api_keys
    FOR INSERT
    WITH CHECK (auth.uid() = user_id);

Testing Checklist

Feedback Submission

API Keys Save

Deployment Notes

Prerequisites

Ensure these migrations are applied to production: 1. 20251112000001_create_feedback_table.sql - Feedback table with priority column 2. 20251112180000_create_user_api_keys_table.sql - User API keys table with RLS policies

Rollback Plan

If issues occur: 1. Revert to previous commit on main branch 2. The changes are isolated to two components 3. No database schema changes required for rollback

Files Modified

  1. your-projects/src/components/carbon/FeedbackModal.tsx
    • Fixed type mismatch (bug/idea vs bug/feature)
    • Removed explicit priority field from insert
  2. your-projects/src/components/carbon/ApiKeysSettingsModal.tsx
    • Enhanced session validation
    • Improved error handling with specific messages
    • Added comprehensive debugging logs
